metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23986 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A malicious extension with the 'search' permission could have installed anew search engine whose favicon referenced a cross-origin URL. The responseto this cross-origin request could have been read by the extension,allowing a same-origin policy bypass by the extension, which should nothave cross-origin permissions. This cross-origin request was made withoutcookies, so the sensitive information disclosed by the violation waslimited to local-network resources or resources that perform IP-basedauthentication. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 87.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23986` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
